meanings.definition: Given to talking too much or too freely; garrulous.
meanings.sent1: She is the mouthier one in our group, always chatting non-stop.
meanings.sent2: He became even mouthier after drinking a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was so mouthier today, mimicking everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her mouthier nature was like a waterfall of words, never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The mouthier child in the class could be heard from across the playground.

meanings.sent1: The mouthier professor never let anyone else speak during the lecture.
meanings.sent2: She became even mouthier when the topic turned to her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The mouthier cat meowed loudly to get attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: His mouthier tendencies were like a constant stream of words flowing out.
meanings.sent5: The mouthier student in the class always had a story to share.

meanings.definition: Speaking in a loud, boastful, or opinionated manner.
meanings.sent1: The mouthier politician made grand promises to win votes.
meanings.sent2: She grew even mouthier when challenged on her beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The mouthier dog barked proudly at the passing mailman.
meanings.sent4: His mouthier attitude was like a roaring lion in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The mouthier neighbor always had something to say about everyone's business.
